openconnector

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    All methods in this class, except #getMapFromItemsList(List) have been marked as DEPRECATED and will no longer support any enhancements.

    It is advised to use connector.common.Util for future development.

      • atoi

        @Deprecated
public static int atoi(java.lang.String a)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a String value into an unboxed int. Truncate doubles and return the floor. Tolerate null strings, and invalid integer strings and return 0.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#atoi(String).

      • otoi

public static int otoi(java.lang.Object o)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a random object into an unboxed int.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#otoi(Object).

      • otos

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String otos(java.lang.Object o)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert an object to its string representation. This will convert Lists and Collections to comma-separated lists. Any other object is simply returned as its toString() representation.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#otos(Object).

        Parameters:
        o - The object to convert to a string.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the given object, or null if the given object is null.

      • getMapFromItemsList

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getMapFromItemsList(java.util.List<Item> items)
        This method fetches all attribute(items) from plan. It convert item list to map.

      • listToQuotedCsv

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String listToQuotedCsv(java.util.List list,
                                                           java.lang.Character quoteChar,
                                                           boolean filterEmpty)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a list of strings into a comma delimited list of Strings wrapped in the specified type of quote. If null as provided as the quote type no quotes are applied.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#listToQuotedCsv(List, Character, boolean).

        Parameters:
        list - List of objects to be converted into a list of strings
        quoteChar - Quote character in which to wrap the strings. Can be ', ", or null. If null is specified no quotes will be applied
        filterEmpty - True to filter blank strings out of the list. False to include them
        Returns:
        String representation of a comma delimited list of Strings wrapped in the specified type of quote

      • listToQuotedCsv

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String listToQuotedCsv(java.util.List list,
                                                           java.lang.Character quoteChar,
                                                           boolean filterEmpty,
                                                           boolean conditionallyQuote)
        Deprecated. 
        This is similar to listToQuoteCsv but allows the specification of the conditionally quoted individual values in a csv that have embedded commas.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#listToQuotedCsv(List, Character, boolean, boolean).

        Parameters:
        conditionallyQuote - True prevents ALL strings from being quoted, and instead will only quote ( escape ) the values that actually contain embedded commas.
        Returns:
        String representation of the list
        See Also:
        Util.listToQuotedCsv(List, Character, boolean)

      • listToQuotedCsv

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String listToQuotedCsv(java.util.List list,
                                                           java.lang.Character quoteChar,
                                                           boolean filterEmpty,
                                                           boolean conditionallyQuote,
                                                           boolean conditionallyAddSpace)
        Deprecated. 
        This is similar to listToQuoteCsv but allows the specification of the conditionally add space char between the csv values.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#listToQuotedCsv(List, Character, boolean, boolean, boolean).

        Parameters:
        list - List of objects to be converted into a list of strings
        quoteChar - Quote character in which to wrap the strings. Can be ', ", or null. If null is specified no quotes will be applied
        filterEmpty - True to filter blank strings out of the list. False to include them
        conditionallyQuote - If true it prevents ALL strings from being quoted, and instead will only quote ( escape ) the values that actually contain embedded commas.
        conditionallyAddSpace - If true it appends a space before adding the next value.
        Returns:
        String representation of the list

      • asList

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List asList(java.lang.Object o)
        Deprecated. 
        Return a List with the given object. If the object is a List, it is returned. If the object is a collection, a List with all of the elements of the collection is returned. If the object is a non-collection, a new List containing the given object is returned. If the object is null, null is returned.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#asList(Object).

        Parameters:
        o - The object to return as a list.

      • getString

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String s)
        Deprecated.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#getString(String).

        Parameters:
        s - The String to filter.
        Returns:
        The given String or null (if the given String is null or zero-length).

      • replaceCharacter

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String replaceCharacter(java.lang.String toReplace,
                                                            java.lang.String replaceWith,
                                                            java.lang.String str)
        Deprecated. 
        Function to replace a charecter with other charecter in any string.

        Please make use of connector.common.Util#replaceCharacter(String, String, String).

        Parameters:
        toReplace - - Variable to hold the value for the charecter to be replaced.
        replaceWith - - variable to hold the value for the charecter to which will replace.
        str - - A string whose value need to be changed.
        Returns:
        - Return new string where any given character is replaced by any other character specified in argument.
